sources.note: Homepage with company description, product overview, module list, partner logos (SureScripts, DoseSpot, Dragon). Urology-focused EHR.
ONC certification statement, EHI export download link, FHIR service bundle link. Standard compliance page.
Detailed module descriptions including MyEMR, Care Pathways, Risk Management, Data Mining, Clinical Trials, Billing. Urology focus emphasized.
EHR feature page: point-and-click interface, FastCharting (30-second renal stone consult), urology templates, mobile access, voice dictation.
Founder Dr. Ashu Kataria, company mission/philosophy. 'Built by urologists, with urologists in mind.'
Integration details: lab interfaces, hospital interfaces, SureScripts, existing PM systems. FHIR API documentation link.
PRACTICE iQ stepped therapy module. Manages drug program qualification, pre-authorization, billing. Claims $2,500-$7,500/patient revenue.
Clinical risk alerts for urology (stent tracking, missed ultrasounds). Available standalone for clinics using other EHRs. Related to RiskAssistMD.
MU attestation dashboard, CQM/PQRS support, automated reporting capabilities.
RWT results: tested at urology clinics, sample size n=10, 99% benchmark. Some criteria tested in InPracSys Lab (not at live clinic sites).
2023-2026 RWT plans/results. All criteria passed with 0 errors on n=10. Confirms very small deployment footprint.
Patient portal demo for Comprehensive Urologic Care, S.C. (Lake Barrington, IL). Reveals real customer name and portal URL.
Educational articles only (ICD-10, HIPAA, EHR tips). No case studies or customer testimonials found.
Legal name Innovative Practice Systems, Inc. Founded 2003. ~25 employees, ~$820K revenue. Minneapolis, MN. SIC codes for computer services.
Product listed but no substantive review content or user ratings found.
No G2 listing found for InPracSys. No reviews on any major review platform (also checked Capterra, Software Advice).
